About Audiofix

Audiofix is the South West's premier service and repair centre for both modern and retro DJ equipment. After initially specailising in the mighty Technics SL-1200/1210 series turntables, we've since expanded to handle all brands of turntables, CDJs, DJ mixers, controllers, and other audio equipment.

We keep the focus on high quality workmanship with a quick turnaround time, and our customer service keeps our clients happy. Check out our testimonials to hear from our happy customers!

THE MAN BEHIND THE WORKBENCH

Meet Jamie

All of our servicing and repairs are completed in house by Jamie.

By day he's the heart and soul of Audiofix, and by night he's a vinyl DJ playing venues all over the south of England. Jamie is a member of the Musicians Union, and his servicing and repair work is fully insured.

Jamie has a BA (Hons) in Music Production and Sound Engineering from Bristol's own dBs Music, and since graduating in 2018 has been servicing equipment for music lovers all over the South West.

Audiofix Service

BEFORE

AFTER

A complete Audiofix service will have your gear feeling brand new again.

Our bread and butter is the industry leading Technics SL-1200/1210 series turntable. First released in 1972, we've seen countless variations come over the workbench. A well looked after 1210 has the potential to be passed down to the grandkids with a thorough service every once in a while!

We stock a wide range of original, genuine Technics parts to allow a quick turnaround to your service or repair.

turntable Service

A turntable service will include but is not limited to;

  • Deep clean inside and out
  • Check soldering on all PCBs and reflow loose connections
  • Components assessed for heat damage
  • Check condition of operation base (33/45/power buttons)
  • Check and calibrate electronic brake
  • Strip, clean and lubricate pitch fader
  • Remove pitch 0% click (if requested)
  • Full pitch fader range and gain calibration under oscilloscope
  • Check and lubricate centre shaft
  • Check tonearm functions including height adjust, anti-skate and arm lift
  • Check tonearm cartridge contacts
  • Platter cleaned
  • PAT Test and label

We can also upgrade the audio cable and grounding wire for £25 per deck. The cables are custom made in-house 1.2m Van Damme cables with gold plated Neutrik RCA connectors and a new grounding wire bound together.

Book a Technics service

CDJs Service

A CDJ service will include but is not limited to;

  • Full unit test (with MIDI Mapping software)
  • Deep clean inside and out
  • Replace Play/Pause + Cue button tact switches (parts included)
  • Jog wheel stripped, cleaned and bearings aligned
  • Laser unit and pickup stripped and cleaned
  • Clean and lubricate all potentiometers and faders
  • LCD test (if applicable)
  • Deoxidise inputs / outputs
  • Firmware update
  • PAT Test and label
Book a CDJ service

Controller Service

A controller service will include but is not limited to;

  • Full unit test (with MIDI Mapping software)
  • Deep clean inside and out
  • Replace Play/Pause + Cue button tact switches (parts included)
  • Jog wheel stripped, cleaned and bearings aligned
  • Clean and lubricate all potentiometers and faders
  • LCD test (if applicable)
  • Deoxidise inputs / outputs
  • Firmware update
  • PAT Test and label
Book a Controller service

DJ Mixers Service

A DJ Mixer service will include but is not limited to;

  • Full unit test (with MIDI Mapping software)
  • Deep clean inside and out
  • Clean all PCBs and check solder connections
  • Reflow loose connections
  • Clean and lubricate all potentiometers and faders
  • Clean and de-oxidise all inputs and outputs
  • PAT Test and label
Book a DJ Mixer service

Audiofix Repairs

BEFORE

AFTER

Our repair process is slightly different to the service process. Some of our clients know what the issue is in advance of a repair job, while for others a diganostic is required. Either way, it won't be long until your equipment is up and running again, squeaky clean and good as new.

For repairs we charge a standard bench fee at the beginning of the job. This fee is deducted from the labor component of the final invoice.

Book your faulty equipment in with Audiofix today.
